Package mf

Interface MessageBus

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MessageBusController
    public interface MessageBus
    MessageBus is the interface with which the application interacts with the messaging framework.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addConnection​(java.lang.String identifier, java.lang.String ip, int port)
      Add new outgoing connection.
      void addMessageResponse​(MessageHandler handler)
      Subscribes to a message type.
      boolean hasConnection​(java.lang.String identifier)
      Check, whether a connection is already present in the message bus
      void publishMessageTo​(java.lang.String receiver, java.lang.Class<?> messageType, java.lang.Object message)
      Passes a message object to the framework for sending to a specific receiver
      void publishMessageToAny​(java.lang.Class<?> messageType, java.lang.Object message)
      Passes a message object to the framework for publishing the message (everybody receives the message)
      void removeConnection​(java.lang.String identifier)
      Remove outgoing connection.
      void removeMessageResponse​(java.lang.Class<?> messageType)
      Unsubscribe from a message type.
      void stop()
      Allows you to stop all threads of the message bus.

    • Method Detail

      • publishMessageTo

        void publishMessageTo​(java.lang.String receiver,
                      java.lang.Class<?> messageType,
                      java.lang.Object message)
        Passes a message object to the framework for sending to a specific receiver
        Parameters:
        receiver - Id of peer to which the message should be sent
        messageType - Class type of which the message object is
        message - Message object to be sent

      • publishMessageToAny

        void publishMessageToAny​(java.lang.Class<?> messageType,
                         java.lang.Object message)
        Passes a message object to the framework for publishing the message (everybody receives the message)
        Parameters:
        messageType - Class type of which the message object is
        message - Message object to be sent

      • addMessageResponse

        void addMessageResponse​(MessageHandler handler)
        Subscribes to a message type. You will receive messages of this type from now on.
        Parameters:
        handler - An object defining the response to a received message

      • removeMessageResponse

        void removeMessageResponse​(java.lang.Class<?> messageType)
        Unsubscribe from a message type. You will not receive messages of this type anymore.
        Parameters:
        messageType - Message type to which the application does not want to receive anymore

      • addConnection

        void addConnection​(java.lang.String identifier,
                   java.lang.String ip,
                   int port)
        Add new outgoing connection. Messages will also be sent/forwarded to this connection from now on.
        Parameters:
        identifier - Identifier of a communication partner
        ip - IP address of the outgoing connection
        port - Port number of the outgoing connection

      • hasConnection

        boolean hasConnection​(java.lang.String identifier)
        Check, whether a connection is already present in the message bus
        Parameters:
        identifier - Identifier of a communication partner
        Returns:
        Found a connection for the give identifier

      • removeConnection

        void removeConnection​(java.lang.String identifier)
        Remove outgoing connection. Messages will not be sent/forwarded to this connection anymore.
        Parameters:
        identifier - Identifier of a communication partner

      • stop

        void stop()
        Allows you to stop all threads of the message bus. This operation should be called before terminating the program.
